intro: Symphyglossum sanguineum, commonly known as the red-flowered wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in shaded to partially shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to deep red, bloom in late winter to early spring, making it one of the earliest flowering plants in its habitat. The plant's botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native range.
